section.title: Overview
section.p: Bundles are the packages that offer a collection of services for an attractive fee. Subscribers can opt for different bundles offered by the operators. A subscription is an assignment of a bundle to a subscriber.

Consider a postpaid bundle for data, voice, and text. This bundle includes a charging service with a pre-set amount of consumption for data, voice, and text. The services tariff also defines the rating for consumption beyond pre-set allocation of different services. This is done by referring to specific rate entities defining the amounts. For example, 2 GB of data, 500 anytime text, and unlimited evening texts.
A bundle can contain charging services.

An individual account can be associated with zero or more bundles. A device or a group can have bundles associated to them in form of subscription. If the subscription taken by a group, then all the members of the group can use that subscription.
